segment.tokens: She had added a joy to her joyless life
she had also added a care a heavy weight to her heavy load
All her strength was taken now to find food
The burden increased
as the offspring grew up big enough to scramble about the boxes , which they did daily during her absence after they were six weeks old
the boxes they did daily during her absence
after they were six weeks
That troubles go in flocks luck in streaks
is well known in Slumland
Kitty had had three encounters with Dogs
Kitty had been stoned Malee negro during a two days ' starve
Then the tide turned
she found a full milk-can without a lid
The very next morning successfully robbed a barrow pensioner
The very next morning found a big fish-head all within two hours
She had just returned with that perfect peace which comes only of a full stomach , when she saw a little brown creature in her junk-yard
that perfect peace comes only of a full stomach
when she saw a little brown creature in her junk-yard
Hunting memories came back in strength
she did n't know
what it was
she had killed several Mice
she eaten
this was evidently a big with bob-tail and large ears
Kitty stalked it with elaborate but unnecessary caution
the little Rabbit simply sat up
the little Rabbit looked
faintly amused
He did not try to run
Kitty sprang on him
Kitty bore him off
As she was not
she carried him to the cracker-box
she dropped him among the Kittens
He was not much
He got over his fright
since he could not get of the box
out
he snuggled among the Kittens
when they began to take their evening meal
he very soon decided to join them
The old Cat was puzzled
The hunter instinct had been
absence of hunger had saved the Rabbit
absence of hunger given the maternal instinct a chance to appear
The result was
that the Rabbit became a member of the family
the Rabbit was thenceforth guarded with the Kittens
fed
Two weeks went by
The Kittens romped much among the boxes during their mother 's absence
The Rabbit could not get of the box
seeing the Kittens about the back yard
Jap Malee told the negro to shoot them
This he was doing one morning with a 22-calibre rifle
He had shot one after another
He seen
them drop from sight into the crannies of the lumber-pile , when the old Cat came running along the wall from the dock , carrying a small Wharf Rat
the lumber-pile when the old Cat came from the dock
running along the wall
carrying a small Wharf Rat
He had been to shoot her too
that Rat changed his plans
the sight of that Rat changed his plans : a rat-catching Cat was to live
It happened
she had ever caught
it saved her life
She threaded the lumber-maze to the cracker-box
She was probably puzzled to find
that there were no Kittens to come at her call
the Rabbit would not partake of the Rat
Pussy curled up to nurse the Rabbit
she called from time to time to summon the Kittens
Guided that call
the negro crawled quietly to the place to his intense surprise , that it contained the old Cat , a live Rabbit , and a dead Rat
the negro peering down into the cracker-box
the negro saw
that it contained the old Cat a live Rabbit a dead Rat
The mother Cat laid back her ears
The mother Cat snarled
The negro withdrew
a minute later a board was dropped on the opening of the cracker-box
the den with its tenants dead alive was lifted into the bird-cellar
" Say boss look a-hyar
hyar 's
where de little Rabbit got to wot
we lost
Yo sho t ought "
Ah stoled him for de ' tater-bake
Kitty Bunny were carefully put in a large wire cage
Kitty Bunny exhibited as a happy family till a few days later
when the Rabbit took sick
the Rabbit died
Pussy had never been in the cage
She had enough to eat
drink
she craved her freedom
would likely have gotten death liberty now
that during the four days ' captivity she had so cleaned her fur
she slicked
that her unusual coloring was seen
Jap decided to keep her
LIFE II VI Jap Malee was as a little Cockney bantam
as ever sold cheap Canary-birds in a cellar
He was extremely
the negro lived with him
the
because Henglish-man was to share bed board
Henglish-man otherwise admit a perfect equality
that few Americans conceded
Jap was perfectly to his lights
he had n't any lights
it was well known
that his chief revenue was derived storing restoring Dogs Cats
stolen
The half-dozen Canaries were mere
Yet Jap believed in himself
Hi tell you
Sammy me boy
you 'll see me with ' orses of my own yet
" " he would say
when some trifling success inflated his dirty little chest
He was not without ambition in a weak , flabby , once-in-a-while way
he sometimes wished to be known as a fancier

Indeed he had once gone the wild length offering a Cat for exhibition at the Knickerbocker High Society Cat and Pet Show with three not over-clear objects : first , to gratify his ambition ; second to secure the exhibitor free pass third " "
well you kneow one as to kneow the valuable Cats
you kneow
when one goes a-catting
this was a society
the exhibitor had to be introduced
his miserable alleged half-Persian was scornfully rejected
The Lost Found columns of the papers were the only of interest to Jap
he had noticed a clipping about ' breeding for fur
he saved
This was stuck on the wall of his den
under its influence he set about
what seemed a cruel experiment with the Slum Cat
First he soaked her dirty fur with stuff to kill the two three kinds of creepers
she wore
when it had done its work
he washed her thoroughly in soap
warm water of her teeth claws
warm water yowls
Kitty was savagely
a warm happy glow spread over her
as she dried off in a cage near the stove
her fur began to fluff out with wonderful softness and whiteness
Jap his assistant were much with the result
Kitty ought to have been
But this was now for the experiment
Nothing is so growing fur as plenty of oily food
Nothing continued exposure to cold weather
" " said the clipping
Winter was at hand
Jap Malee put Kitty cage out in the yard
Jap Malee protected only from the rain and the direct wind
Jap Malee fed her with all the oil-cake and fish-heads she could eat
she could eat
In a week a change began to show
was
she had nothing to do fat
get
dress her fur
Her cage was kept clean
nature responded to the chill weather and the oily food making Kitty coat thicker glossier every day
so that by midwinter she was an unusually beautiful in the fullest and finest of fur with markings that were at least a rarity
markings were at least a
Jap was much with the result of the experiment
as a very little success had a wonderful effect on him
he began to dream of the paths of glory
Why not send the Slum Cat to the show now coming on
now coming on
before

ye kneow Sammy to henter ' er as a tramp Cat

it kin
